    Introduction to ryx

    ryx.Rmd

    The ryx\ package is a project containing one main function which returns an ryx object and 3 generic functions that take ryx objects as their input and return information about the ryx. An ryx object shows the correlations, p values, and significance of a certain y variable against multiple x variables.

    library(ryx)
    library(ryx)
x <- ryx(mtcars, y="mpg")
print(x)
#> Correlations of mpg with
#>      variable          r            p sigif
#> cor4       wt -0.8676594 1.293959e-10   ***
#> cor       cyl -0.8521620 6.112687e-10   ***
#> cor1     disp -0.8475514 9.380327e-10   ***
#> cor2       hp -0.7761684 1.787835e-07   ***
#> cor3     drat  0.6811719 1.776240e-05   ***
#> cor6       vs  0.6640389 3.415937e-05   ***
#> cor7       am  0.5998324 2.850207e-04   ***
#> cor9     carb -0.5509251 1.084446e-03    **
#> cor8     gear  0.4802848 5.400948e-03    **
#> cor5     qsec  0.4186840 1.708199e-02     *
plot(x)

    summary(x)
#> Correlating mpg with cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb
#> The median absolute correlation was 0.674 with a range from -0.868 to 0.681
#>  10 out of 10 variables were significant at the p < 0.05 level.
